title: Letyat zhuravli = The Cranes are flying
subject_group: Armed Forces, Military, War & Weapons/World War, 1939-1945 - Soviet Union
Armed Forces, Military, War & Weapons/Anti-war works
Armed Forces, Military, War & Weapons/Women in war
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Grief
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Grief - Psychological aspects
abstract: Note: Based on a play by Victor Rusov.
description: An anti-war love story set during the early years of World War II, 'The Cranes Are Flying' is a romantic drama about love, loss and recovery from catastrophe. When a young hospital worker hears that her fiance has been killed in the war, she is traumatised and refuses to believe it. Raped by a distant cousin during an air raid, she eventually marries him, despite feeling no love, and continues to mourn for her dead lover. A subsequent turn of events re-establishes her faith in life and her confidence returns. Winner of Best Film at the Cannes Film Festival, 1958  Credits: Producer, director, Mikhail Kalatozov ; writer, Victor Rosov ; photography, Sergei Urusevski ; music, M. Vainberg ; editing, Mariya Timofeyeva. Cast: Tatiana Samoilova, Alexei Batalov, Vasily Merkuryev, Alexander Shvorin, Svetlana Kharitonova, Konstantin Nikitin.
